verses.text: O that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, That I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!
O that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; That I might leave my people, and go from them! For they \add be\add* all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous \add men\add*.

And they bend their tongues \add like\add* their bow \add for\add* lies: But they are not valiant for the truth upon the earth; For they proceed from evil to evil, And they know not me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Take ye heed every one of his neighbour, And trust ye not in any brother: For every brother will utterly supplant, And every neighbour will walk \add with\add* slanders.
And they will deceive every one his neighbour, And will not speak the truth: They have taught their tongue to speak lies, \add And\add* weary themselves to commit iniquity.
Thine habitation \add is\add* in the midst of deceit; Through deceit they refuse to know me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, Behold, I will melt them, and try them; For how shall I do for the daughter of my people?
Their tongue \add is as\add* an arrow shot out; it speaketh deceit: \add One\add* speaketh peaceably to his neighbour with his mouth, But in heart he layeth his wait.
Shall I not visit them for these \add things?\add* saith the \sc Lord\sc*: Shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, And for the habitations of the wilderness a lamentation, Because they are burnt up, so that none can pass through \add them;\add* Neither can \add men\add* hear the voice of the cattle; Both the fowl of the heavens and the beast Are fled; they are gone.
And I will make Jerusalem heaps, \add and\add* a den of dragons; And I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.

Who \add is\add* the wise man, that may understand this? And \add who is he\add* to whom the mouth of the \sc Lord\sc* hath spoken, that he may declare it, For what the land perisheth \add And\add* is burnt up like a wilderness, that none passeth through?
And the \sc Lord\sc* saith, Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, And have not obeyed my voice, neither walked therein;
But have walked after the imagination of their own heart, And after Baalim, which their fathers taught them:
Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I \add will\add* feed them, \add even\add* this people, with wormwood, And give them water of gall to drink.
I will scatter them also among the heathen, whom neither they nor their fathers have known: And I will send a sword after them, till I have consumed them.
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, Consider ye, and call for the mourning \add women\add*, that they may come; And send for cunning \add women\add*, that they may come:
And let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, That our eyes may run down \add with\add* tears, And our eyelids gush out with waters.
For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we spoiled! We are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, Because our dwellings have cast \add us\add* out.
Yet hear the word of the \sc Lord\sc*, O ye women, And let your ear receive the word of his mouth, And teach your daughters wailing, And every one her neighbour lamentation.
For death is come up into our windows, \add and\add* is entered into our palaces, To cut off the children from without, \add and\add* the young men from the streets.
Speak, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Even the carcases of men shall fall as dung upon the open field, And as the handful after the harvestman, and none shall gather \add them\add*.
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Let not the wise \add man\add* glory in his wisdom, Neither let the mighty \add man\add* glory in his might, Let not the rich \add man\add* glory in his riches:

But let him that glorieth glory in this, That \add he\add* understandeth and knoweth me, That I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* which exercise lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth: For in these \add things\add* I delight, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Behold, the days come, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, That I will punish all \add them which are\add* circumcised with the uncircumcised;

Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, And all \add that are\add* in the utmost corners, that dwell in the wilderness: For all \add these\add* nations \add are\add* uncircumcised, And all the house of Israel \add are\add* uncircumcised in the heart.
